语言选择

欢迎关注“Quora文选”公众号

  • English
  • 中英译文

1. English

What are some things not to do in my life?

Rashmi Rao · Got excellent network of professionals across 50 + domains.

​ 303.8K views · 12.4k Upvotes

  1. Don’t ignore education. Don’t ignore ‘doing well’ in your academics. It’s not everything in life, but it creates an impression.

  2. Don’t ever get too comfortable at one job. Especially if there is not much to learn anymore. Move on.

  3. Don’t ever comment on a persons weight, looks and his/her body type to him/her. Even as a joke. Don’t. Ever. It’s their business really.

  4. Love your parents. They need to know that you care and are happy. Don’t ignore them later in your life.

  5. Don’t ever disregard your relationship. It’s a huge thing for someone to give you their heart and soul. You have to know when to stand up and fight for them or the relationship.

  6. Don’t be lax about hygiene. Take extra care of it.

  7. Don’t do drugs. Like ever. Not even “just once”. Once is all it takes to get hooked.

  8. Don’t forget where you came from. Or where your real roots are.

▌“Quora文选”词汇:

1️⃣ 𝗱𝗶𝘀𝗿𝗲𝗴𝗮𝗿𝗱 /dɪsˈriːɡɑːd, dɪsˈriɡɑːrd/
v. 忽视，不顾
Disregard for safety led to the accident.（忽视安全导致了事故的发生。）

2️⃣ 𝗵𝘆𝗴𝗶𝗲𝗻𝗲 /ˈhaɪdʒiːn, ˈhaɪdʒiːn/
n. 卫生，卫生条件；卫生习惯
Maintaining good hygiene is important for health.（保持良好的卫生习惯对健康很重要。）

3️⃣ 𝗴𝗲𝘁 𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗸𝗲𝗱 /ɡɛt hʊkt, ɡɛt hʊkt/
v. 上瘾，沉迷
She warned me not to get hooked on social media.（她警告我不要沉迷于社交媒体。）

2. 中英译文

生活中有哪些事儿是绝不能做的？_Quora文选

  1. Don’t ignore education. Don’t ignore ‘doing well’ in your academics. It’s not everything in life, but it creates an impression.
    不要忽视教育，不要忽视在学业上取得好成绩。这不是生活中的全部，但它会给人留下印象。

  2. Don’t ever get too comfortable at one job. Especially if there is not much to learn anymore. Move on.
    永远不要在一份工作上做得太过舒适，尤其是当没有什么可学的时候，跳出舒适区，继续前进吧。

  3. Don’t ever comment on a persons weight, looks and his/her body type to him/her. Even as a joke. Don’t Ever! It’s their business really.
    绝对不要评论一个人的体重、外貌和身材，即使是开玩笑也不行！这真的是他们自己的事儿。

  4. Love your parents.They need to know that you care and are happy.Don’t ignore them later in your life.
    爱你的父母。他们需要知道你关心并且幸福，不要在以后的生活中忽略他们。

  5. Don’t ever disregard your relationship.It’s a huge thing for someone to give you their heart and soul.You have to know when to stand up and fight for them or the relationship
    永远不要轻视你们的恋爱关系，对你的另一半来说，把自己的心灵交付给你是一件大事，你必须知道何时站出来为他们或这段关系而战斗.

  6. Don’t be lax about hygiene.Take extra care of it
    别放松卫生方面的要求，要格外注意.

  7. Don’t do drugs.Like ever.Not even “just once”.Once is all it takes toget hooked
    千万别碰毒品，一次都不行，那玩意儿粘上一次就会上瘾.

  8. Don’t forget where you came from.Or where your real roots are
    别忘了你来自哪里，也别忘了自己真正的根在哪里

entry.title: 你妈做过哪些让你抓狂的事儿？_Quora文选
entry.content:
语言选择

欢迎关注“Quora文选”公众号

  • English
  • 中英译文

1. English

How crazy is your mother?

Anshu Singh · Post Doctoral Researcher at University of Helsinki (2020–present)

​ 305.3K views · 24.3k Upvotes

She made me fail in LKG.

I was studying in some weird school and they used to ask stupid questions during exams. In lower kindergarten (LKG) final exam of Hindi subject, I had really performed badly. And as an add-on to that, during some class test, they had asked my father’s name. Though it doesn’t seem that difficult now, at the age of 4–5, I was not able to pronounce his name properly. So, overall I was going to fail (I was not bothered).

When the results were declared and my mother came to collect the report card in the school, the class teacher, in order to please my mother, bragged about how they have passed me in Hindi, even though I was going to fail. (My mother was the education officer of the town).

My mother got so furious at the teacher and took the matter to the principal. She demanded the class teacher fail me. Since the results were already declared and the report card was printed, they said they can’t do anything.


Any guesses what my mother did?

She changed my school. And the reason she gave to the new school principal was, “the previous school was not good enough to fail my kid!”

Mothers are crazy, and when I say crazy, it’s in a lovable way!

▌“Quora文选”词汇:

1️⃣ 𝗯𝗿𝗮𝗴 /bræɡ, bræɡ/
v. 吹牛，自夸
He always brags about how much money he makes.（他总是吹嘘自己赚了多少钱。）

2️⃣ 𝗳𝘂𝗿𝗶𝗼𝘂𝘀 /ˈfjʊəriəs, ˈfjʊrɪəs/
adj. 狂怒的，激烈的
She was furious when she found out her brother had borrowed her car without asking.（当她发现弟弟未经允许就借用了她的车时，她非常愤怒。）

2. 中英译文

你妈做过哪些让你抓狂的事儿？_Quora文选

She made me fail in LKG.
她让我在幼儿园大班考试中不及格。

I was studying in some weird school and they used to ask stupid questions during exams. In lower kindergarten (LKG) final exam of Hindi subject, I had really performed badly. And as an add-on to that, during some class test, they had asked my father’s name. Though it doesn’t seem that difficult now, at the age of 4–5, I was not able to pronounce his name properly. So, overall I was going to fail (I was not bothered).
我当时就读于一所很奇怪的学校，他们在考试中总是提出一些愚蠢的问题。在幼儿园大班的印地语科目期末考试中，我的表现实在太差了。此外，在某次课堂测验中，他们还问到了我的父亲的名字。虽然现在看来这并不难，但在四五岁时，我还不能正确地说出他的名字。因此，总体上我即将不及格（其实我并不介意）。

When the results were declared and my mother came to collect the report card in the school, the class teacher, in order to please my mother, bragged about how they have passed me in Hindi, even though I was going to fail. (My mother was the education officer of the town).
成绩公布那天，我妈来学校领取我的成绩单时，为了讨好我妈，班主任吹嘘说尽管本该让我不及格，但他们还是让我通过了印地语科目。（我妈是镇上的教育官员）。

My mother got so furious at the teacher and took the matter to the principal. She demanded the class teacher fail me. Since the results were already declared and the report card was printed, they said they can’t do anything.
我妈对老师非常生气，并把事情告诉了校长，她要求班主任让我不及格。由于成绩已经公布且成绩单已打印出来，他们表示无能为力。


Any guesses what my mother did?
你能猜到我妈做了什么吗？

She changed my school. And the reason she gave to the new school principal was “the previous school was not good enough to fail my kid!”
她换了一所新学校给我上学，并向新校长解释原因：“之前那所学校连让孩子挂科都做不到！”

Mothers are crazy, and when I say crazy it’s in a lovable way!
我妈真是让我抓狂疯狂啊！这其实是以一种可爱的方式呈现出来的！

entry.title: 你经历过哪些最尴尬的时刻？_Quora文选
entry.content:
语言选择

欢迎关注“Quora文选”公众号

  • English
  • 中英译文

1. English

What are the most embarrassing moments in life?

Anonymous ·

​ 695K views · 34.3k Upvotes

Anonymous due to obvious reasons.

I’m a guy. Year - 2012, I was working as an Engineer in Bangalore. I was supposed to board an overnight bus to Bangalore from City X. I have the habit of informing my dad once i board a bus.

I boarded the bus little early and was texting my friend about some random stuff. A very beautiful girl came and occupied the seat next to mine (It’s very unusual in my place for a girl to occupy the seat next to an unknown guy). I felt very lucky, she was so beautiful. I wanted to inform this to my friend.

Me: “Adjacent seat female. Very beautiful. Lucky tonight😄”

Didn’t receive any reply for a few mins. Opened my mobile to realize that unknowingly I had sent this message to my dad. For a minute I didn’t know what to do, i was shit scared.

The phone buzzed. It was a text from my dad.

My Dad: “Enjoy 😄😄😄”

▌“Quora文选”词汇:

1️⃣ 𝗯𝘂𝘇𝘇 /bʌz, bʊz/
n. 手机的振动；v. 使手机振动
My phone buzzed with a new message.（我的手机因为一条新消息而振动。）

2. 中英译文

你经历过哪些最尴尬的时刻？_Quora文选

Anonymous due to obvious reasons.
因显而易见的原因，匿了。

I’m a guy. Year - 2012, I was working as an Engineer in Bangalore. I was supposed to board an overnight bus to Bangalore from City X. I have the habit of informing my dad once i board a bus.
我是一名男士，那是2012年，我在班加罗尔担任工程师。我计划从X城市乘坐夜班车前往班加罗尔。每次上车后，我都有向父亲报平安的习惯。

I boarded the bus little early and was texting my friend about some random stuff. A very beautiful girl came and occupied the seat next to mine (It’s very unusual in my place for a girl to occupy the seat next to an unknown guy). I felt very lucky, she was so beautiful. I wanted to inform this to my friend.
我稍早些时候登上了巴士，并给朋友发短信聊了些杂七杂八的事情。一个非常漂亮的女孩儿上车，并坐在我的旁边（在我们这里，女孩儿与不认识的男性同坐极为少见）。她长得如此漂亮，让我感觉自己非常幸运，于是我想把这件事告诉我的朋友。

Me: “Adjacent seat female. Very beautiful. Lucky tonight😄”
我：“邻座是位非常漂亮的女士，今晚真幸运😄”

Didn’t receive any reply for a few mins. Opened my mobile to realize that unknowingly I had sent this message to my dad. For a minute I didn’t know what to do, i was shit scared.
几分钟也没有收到回复，打开手机才意识到不知不觉中将这条消息发送给了我爸爸，一时间弄得我不知所措，吓得要命。

The phone buzzed. It was a text from my dad.
之后手机震了一下，是我爸爸发来的短信。

My Dad: “Enjoy 😄😄😄”
我爸爸回了条信息：“Enjoy😄😄😄"

entry.title: 今天，你对生活有了什么新的认识？_Quora文选
entry.content:
语言选择

欢迎关注“Quora文选”公众号

  • English
  • 中英译文

1. English

What did you learn today about life?

Pratik Mane · Analyst at Kantar Operations (2018–present)Updated 6y

​ 448.9K views · 17.8k Upvotes

My roommate is in a romantic relationship for about 5 years and both want to get married. He’s very close to me so I know a lot about their relationship and what’s going on between them.

Both of them live in hostels and meet pretty often. Since a couple of months, his girlfriend is insisting him to meet and travel somewhere near. But he says he can’t as he is stuck in college doing a lot of activities. They haven’t met since 2 months.

Today she met with a serious road accident and is in the ICU. He is in trauma. He keeps crying continuously. I haven’t seen someone in this condition. He keeps telling me that he should have met her and spent more time with her. See how his life flipped.

Last two months, he could have met her any time he wanted; now there’s no guarantee he can ever meet her even if wants too :(. He is cursing himself for his behavior. He is drowning in floods of regret.


You know what? He took her for granted. That anyway he’s gonna marry her so he has a lifetime to spend with her, so meeting her now wasn’t necessary.

I’ve learnt never to take anyone for granted. May it be your parents, siblings or partner. You never know what is going to happen tomorrow, treat them like it’s their last day. Trust me even if this might be a hurdle in your ambitions, it will keep you happy, both in the short and the long run.

If you want to know how rich you are, don’t count your money, just roll down tears and count how many hands come to wipe it.

▌“Quora文选”词汇:

1️⃣ 𝗵𝗼𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗹 /ˈhɒstl, ˈhɑːstəl/
n. 青年旅社，旅馆
I booked a room in a hostel for my upcoming trip.（我为即将到来的旅行预订了一个旅馆的房间。）

2️⃣ 𝘁𝗿𝗮𝘂𝗺𝗮 /ˈtrɔːmə, ˈtroʊmə/
n. 创伤，外伤；精神创伤
The accident caused both physical trauma and emotional distress.（这次事故造成了身体上的创伤和情感上的困扰。）

3️⃣ 𝗵𝘂𝗿𝗱𝗹𝗲 /ˈhɜːdəl, ˈhɜːrdəl/
n. 障碍，难关；v. 跳过障碍
She had to hurdle several challenges before achieving success.（她必须克服几个挑战才能取得成功。）

2. 中英译文

今天，你对生活有了什么新的认识？_Quora文选

My roommate is in a romantic relationship for about 5 years and both want to get married. He’s very close to me so I know a lot about their relationship and what’s going on between them.
我的室友与他的恋人已经相爱约五年，两人都有结婚的意愿。由于我们关系密切，因此我对他们之间的情感纠葛和种种事态颇为了解。

Both of them live in hostels and meet pretty often. Since a couple of months, his girlfriend is insisting him to meet and travel somewhere near. But he says he can’t as he is stuck in college doing a lot of activities. They haven’t met since 2 months.
二人均住在旅舍中，并频繁见面。然而近几个月来，他的女友一直催促要见面并且去附近游玩。但他以学业繁忙、课外活动缠身为由表示无法成行。自此，两月未曾相见。

Today she met with a serious road accident and is in the ICU. He is in trauma. He keeps crying continuously. I haven’t seen someone in this condition. He keeps telling me that he should have met her and spent more time with her. See how his life flipped.
今日，她不幸遭遇重大交通事故，目前在重症监护室接受治疗。这让他极度震惊并陷入深深的悲伤之中，泪流不止。我从未见过如此情形，他不断地向我倾诉道应该更多地去见她、陪伴她。看吧，命运是如何突然颠覆了一切。

Last two months, he could have met her any time he wanted; now there’s no guarantee he can ever meet her even if wants too :(. He is cursing himself for his behavior. He is drowning in floods of regret.
过去两个月里，只要心意所至便能随时与她相会；而现在即使万分渴望也无法保证再次相逢 :( 。他因自己当初的行为而悔恨不已，在后悔之海中挣扎沉沦。

You know what? He took her for granted. That anyway he’s gonna marry her so he has a lifetime to spend with her, so meeting her now wasn’t necessary.
你知道吗？他将她视作理所当然——反正最终会与她步入婚姻殿堂共度一生，因此认为眼下没必要特别安排和她相聚的时间。

I’ve learnt never to take anyone for granted. May it be your parents, siblings or partner. You never know what is going to happen tomorrow, treat them like it’s their last day. Trust me even if this might be a hurdle in your ambitions, it will keep you happy, both in the short and the long run.
这件事教会了我永远不要将任何人视作理所当然——无论是父母、兄弟姐妹还是伴侣！谁也预料不到明天会发生什么，请像珍惜彼此最后一天般对待每一个共同时刻吧！请信我：即便这可能暂时阻碍你追求梦想之路上前进的脚步，在长远来看却能带给你真正的幸福和满足感。

If you want to know how rich you are, don’t count your money, just roll down tears and count how many hands come to wipe it.
如果你想知道自己究竟有多富有，请勿看你的存钱多少；只需让泪水滑落，并数清楚有多少双手愿意帮你轻拭那泪痕。

entry.content:
语言选择

欢迎关注“Quora文选”公众号

  • English
  • 中英译文

1. English

Which are some of the most amazing stories ever?

Dhawal Barot · Just another writer

​ 89.5K views · 10.1k Upvotes

“You still owe me 1000 INR.” Neel reminded Raj on Whatsapp.

“Oh! Keep asking for that.” Raj answered with smilies.

His wife Meera had a glimpse of their conversation and she questioned, “What’s this all about?”

“Ah! Just ignore.” Raj answered.

“Nah, tell me, why did he ask you for money? Why don’t you pay him back?” Meera asked.

Raj smiled and answered, “It’s been five years. When we were in college, I asked him for 500 rupees to check whether he will give me or not. That idiot gave me 1000 without even asking for a reason. That was the day when we became best buddies. And, the day when I’ll return him money, the game will be over. Trust me, I want him to ping me for those 1000 INR till the end.”

Meera was a smart girl. She understood Raj’s context. Thus, she just said, “Will you owe me 500 INR?”

Raj smiled and asked, “For how much time?”

Meera looked into Raj’s eyes and answered, “Like for the life time.”

▌“Quora文选”词汇:

1️⃣ 𝗶𝗻𝗿 /ˌaɪ ˌɛn ˈɑːr, ˌaɪ ˌɛn ˈɑːr/
n.Indian rupee, ISO 4217 currency code: INR 印度卢比（货币单位）
The exchange rate for INR to USD varies daily.（印度卢比兑换美元的汇率每天都在变化。）

2. 中英译文

有哪些有史以来最令人惊叹的小故事？_Quora文选

“You still owe me 1000 INR.” Neel reminded Raj on Whatsapp.
“你还欠我1000印度卢比。”Neel在Whatsapp上提醒Raj。

“Oh! Keep asking for that.” Raj answered with smilies.
“哦！继续催吧。”Raj回答道，笑着说。

His wife Meera had a glimpse of their conversation and she questioned, “What’s this all about?”
他的妻子Meera瞥了一眼他们的对话，并问道：“这是怎么回事？”

Said my son.

I had never thought our paths would cross like this. Probably he was thinking the same.

“Namaste ji!”

‘Namaste.’ I said.

Courageously.

When I was twenty my parents, who had divorced but were now living together, asked me to go on a weekend trip with them.

I was amazed my father would even ask. We weren’t close, I barely spoke to him! He had been physically abusive to my mom, siblings, and especially me my whole life.

I ran away from home at 13, married at 16 so I’d never be under his thumb again. Yet suddenly he wants to be cozy! My mom was a sweet but weak woman! She just never knew when to get out.


This invitation came on the weekend of my 20th birthday, my dad was insistent I go. I came up with all sorts of excuses. I had to work, my husband had to work, dad was fine with the latter excuse (said just the 3 of us would be great). I knew it was a rotten idea from the beginning, he’d get drunk, they’d fight, I’d be referee. No way!

The more he pushed the idea the worse I felt about it, I just knew something was wrong. I finally just said there was no way I’d go we’d already made plans for a birthday party with friends so they went alone.

Two days later on my 20th birthday the State Police came to tell me my parents were dead, my father had killed my mother and then committed suicide. From a note he had left it was quite clear why he was so adamant that I came along. My instincts that day told me the trip was a bad idea and yes I was right.


I had told mom after the divorce to never let him back in her life but she always thought he would change. I have posted parts of this answer before and just want to say in advance that I am fine with my life. I am happily married to the love of my life with a amazing grown son and grandchildren. We have now been married for more than fifty-one years and are still deeply in love with each other.

What did you learn too late in life?

Virat Chaudhary · Works at AasaanHai.netUpdated 4y

​ 169K views · 13.1k Upvotes

  1. Health is the real wealth.
  2. Personal life is more important than professional life (90% happiness depends on relationship).
  3. Being rich is better than looking rich.
  4. Savings and investment are one of the most precious friends in life.
  5. Heartbreak is not end of life.
  6. Time heals everything.
  7. Dedication = freedom.
  8. Hard-work and consistency is the key to achieving anything.
  9. Struggle show you the real face of your friends and relatives.
  10. Sometimes you will value things and people after losing.
  11. Your biggest enemy and friend is your thoughts. Either they make you or break you.
  12. Self love is the biggest asset of life.
  13. Best things never got easy.
  14. Motivation is nothing without action.
  15. Time is precious so don’t waste it on gossip and silly things, live your life with purpose.
  16. Good habits have power to change your life.
  17. No one loves you as your parents do.
  18. Being in wrong relationship is worst.
  19. Spirituality make you wiser, more humble, stronger and brings more happiness.
